seniority_level.evidence: No explicit years mentioned, but 'Bank data background' and 'Audit knowledge' suggest mid-level experience needed; title is generic 'Data Engineer' without senior/staff prefix

job_family.evidence: Job title is explicitly 'Data Engineer' and skills align with core data engineering responsibilities

sub_specialty.evidence: Cloud Databricks and SQL are core for batch ETL; no streaming tools mentioned; bank/audit context implies scheduled, reliable pipelines

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of mentoring, team leadership, or architecture responsibilities; contract role with 6-month duration suggests individual contributor focus

primary_cloud.evidence: Cloud Databricks is mentioned; Databricks is commonly deployed on Azure in enterprise banking contexts, especially with TD (Toronto Dominion) preference; no other cloud specified

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud platforms mentioned in requirements or description

processing_paradigm.evidence: Banking and audit data typically involve scheduled, batch-oriented ETL; no real-time or streaming tools (Kafka, Flink, Kinesis) mentioned

orchestrator_category.evidence: Cloud Databricks implies Spark-native orchestration; no mention of Airflow, dbt, or cloud-native orchestrators

storage_layer.evidence: Databricks is a lakehouse platform; bank data often stored in structured/semi-structured formats in lakehouse architectures

remote_restriction.evidence: Location specified as Toronto, Ontario with hybrid model (2 days/week in office) implies must be local to the region

timezone_focus.evidence: Explicitly located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada; no mention of global or multi-timezone teams

relocation_required.evidence: Hybrid model requiring 2 days/week in Toronto implies candidate must be able to relocate or already reside there

h1b_friendly.evidence: No visa sponsorship mentioned; location in Canada (not US) makes H1B irrelevant; Canadian work authorization likely required

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: Contract role in Canada; OPT/CPT are US-specific student visas; no indication of student visa support

citizenship_required.evidence: No citizenship requirement stated; hybrid role in Toronto implies need for Canadian work authorization

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Contract role with fixed 6-month duration; no mention of benefits or W2 employment; typical for 1099 contractors in Canada/US

benefits_level.evidence: No benefits listed in Pass 1 extraction; contract role typically excludes standard employee benefits

growth_path_clarity.evidence: No mention of career progression, promotion paths, or growth opportunities in job description or Pass 1

mentorship_signals.evidence: No mention of mentorship, coaching, or working with senior staff

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No mention of promotions, advancement, or career ladder

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, role changes, or mobility opportunities

career_tracks_available.evidence: No career tracks (IC, management, etc.) mentioned in job posting or Pass 1

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear must-have skills (Cloud Databricks, SQL, Bank data, Audit) vs. one nice-to-have (worked in TD); balanced requirement structure

scope_definition.evidence: Focused on data engineering with specific domain (banking/audit) and tooling (Databricks, SQL); not multi-role or vague

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skills required (Databricks, SQL, banking/audit) are reasonable for a mid-level data engineer; no unrealistic combinations or senior-level expectations
